turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Hicks, don't let him leave.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: We ain't going anywhere.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Ellen.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Don't be long, Ellen.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Hey, Vasquez...you ever been mistaken for a man?

turns.speaker: VASQUEZ
turns.text: No.  Have you?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Somebody said alien...she thought they said illegal alien and signed up.

turns.speaker: VASQUEZ
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Anytime.  Anywhere.

turns.speaker: VASQUEZ
turns.text: All right, we can't blow the fuck out of them...why not roll some canisters of CN-20 down there. Nerve gas the whole nest?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Look, man, let's just bug out and call it even, okay?

turns.speaker: VASQUEZ
turns.text: Yeah, bullshit.  Watch us.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Maybe you haven't been keeping up on current events, but we just got out asses kicked, pal!

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Oh, man.  And I was gettin' short, too!  Four more weeks and out. Now I'm gonna buy it on this fuckin' rock.  It ain't half fair, man!

turns.speaker: VASQUEZ
turns.text: Hudson, give us a break.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: It's inside the complex.

turns.speaker: VASQUEZ
turns.text: You're just reading me.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: No.  No!  It ain't you.  They're inside.  Inside the perimeter. They're in here.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Sounds like you, Hicks.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: The embryo, the second form, hosts in the victim's body for several hours.  Gestating.  Then it...  ...then it...emerges.  Moults. Grows rapidly --

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Looks like it stung him.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Hey...hey!  Look, Crowe and Dietrich aren't dead, man.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You can't help them.  Right now they're being cocooned just like the others.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Oh, God.  Jesus.  This ain't happening.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Man, we're not going to make it seventeen hours!  Those things are going to come in here, just like they did before, man... they're going to come in here and get us, man, long before...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: She survived longer than that with no weapons and no training.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: This service tunnel is how they're moving back and forth.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Yeah, right, it runs from the processing station right into the sublevel here.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Uh, what's next?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: We need the other drop-ship.  The on one the Sulaco.  We have to bring it down on remote, somehow.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: How?  The transmitter was on the APC.  It's wasted.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I don't care how!  Think of a way.  Think of something.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Think of what?  We're fucked.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What about the colony transmitter? That up-link tower down at the other end.  Why can't we use that?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Well then somebody's just going to have to go out there.  Take a portable terminal and go out there and plug in manually.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Oh, right!  Right!  With those things running around.  No way.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: They cut the power.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: What do you mean, they cut the power?  How could they cut the power, man?  They're animals.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: This signal's weird...must be some interference or something. There's movement all over the place...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Just get back here!

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Range twenty meters.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Seal the door.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Fifteen meters.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I don't know, an acid hole in a duct.  Something under the floors, not on the plans. I don't know!

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Twelve meters.  Man, this is a big fucking signal.  Ten meters.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: They're right on us.  Vasquez, how you doing?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Nine meters.  Eight.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Can't be.  That's inside the room!

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: It's readin' right.  Look!

turns.speaker: LYDECKER
turns.text: You remember you sent some wildcatters out to that plateau, out past the Ilium range, a couple days ago?

turns.speaker: SIMPSON
turns.text: Yeah.  What?

turns.speaker: LYDECKER
turns.text: There's a guy on the horn, mom-and-pop survey team.  Says he's homing on something and wants to know if his claim will be honored.

turns.speaker: SIMPSON
turns.text: Christ.  Some honch in a cushy office on Earth says go look at a grid reference in the middle of nowhere, we look.  They don't say why, and I don't ask.  I don't ask because it takes two weeks to get an answer out here and the answer's always 'don't ask.'

turns.speaker: LYDECKER
turns.text: So what do I tell this guy?

turns.speaker: SIMPSON
turns.text: Tell him, as far as I'm concerned, he finds something it's his.

turns.speaker: MED-TECH
turns.text: And how are we today?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Terrible.

turns.speaker: MED-TECH
turns.text: Just terrible?  That's better than yesterday at least.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: How long have I been on Gateway station?

turns.speaker: MED-TECH
turns.text: Just a couple of days.  Do you feel up to a visitor?

turns.speaker: MED-TECH
turns.text: Bad dreams again?  Do you want something to help you sleep?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: No.. I've slept enough.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What did you say?

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Newt.  My n-name's Newt. Nobody calls me Rebecca except my dork brother.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Casey.  She's my only friend.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What about me?

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: I don't want you for a friend.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Because you'll be gone soon, like the others.  Like everybody.  You'll be dead and you'll leave me alone.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: They'd be here if they could, honey.  I know they would.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: They're dead.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Newt.  Look at me...Newt.  I won't leave you.  I promise.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: You promise?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Cross my heart.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: And hope to die?

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: I was the best at the game. I knew the whole maze.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: The 'maze'?  You mean the air ducts?

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Yeah, you know.  In the walls, under the floor.  I was the ace.  I could hide better than anybody.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You're really something, ace.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: I guess we're not leaving, right?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I'm sorry, Newt.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: You don't have to be sorry.  It wasn't your fault.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Now you just lie here and have a nap.  You're exhausted.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: I don't want to...I have scary dreams.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Ripley...she doesn't have bad dreams because she's just a piece of plastic.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Oh.  Sorry, Newt.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: My mommy always said there were no monsters.  No real ones.  But there are.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Yes, there are, aren't there.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Why do they tell little kids that?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Well, some kids can't handle it like you can.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Did one of those things grow inside her?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I don't know, Newt.  That's the truth.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Isn't that how babies come? I mean people babies...they grow inside you?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: No, it's different, honey.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Did you ever have a baby?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Yes.  A little girl.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Gone.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: You mean dead.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Don't go!  Please.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I'll be right in the other room, Newt.  And look...I can see you on that camera right up there.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Newt.  Newt, wake up.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Wah...?  Where are...?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Sssh.  Don't move.  We're in trouble.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Mommy...I mean, Ripley...I'm scared.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I know, honey.  Me too.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Burke!  Open the door!

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Look!

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Come on.  Crawl faster.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: DO you know how to get to the landing field from here?

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Sure.  Go left.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: This way.  Come on, we're almost there!

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Newt, wait!

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: I knew you'd come.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Newt, I want you to hang on, now.  Hang on tight.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Mommy...Mommy?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Right here, baby.  Right here.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Are we going to sleep now?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: NEWT
turns.text: Can we dream?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Yes, honey.  I think we both can.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Look, I told you...

turns.speaker: VAN LEUWEN
turns.text: It did not, however, contain any entries concerning the hostile life form you allegedly picked up.

turns.speaker: VAN LEUWEN
turns.text: The analysis team which went over your shuttle centimeter by centimeter found no physical evidence of the creature you describe...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: That's because I blew it out the Goddamn airlock!  Like I said.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Look, I can see where this is going.  But I'm telling you those things exist.  Back on that planetoid is an alien ship and on that ship are thousands of eggs.  Thousands. Do you understand?  I suggest you find it, using the flight recorder's data.  Find it and deal with it -- before one of your survey teams comes back with a little surprise...

turns.speaker: VAN LEUWEN
turns.text: Thank you, Officer Ripley.  That will be...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: ...because just one of those things managed to kill my entire crew, within twelve hours of hatching...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Why won't you check out LV-426?

turns.speaker: VAN LEUWEN
turns.text: Because I don't have to.  The people who live there checked it out years ago and they never reported and 'hostile organism' or alien ship.  And by the way, they call it Acheron now.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What are you talking about. What people?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: How many colonists?

turns.speaker: VAN LEUWEN
turns.text: Sixty, maybe seventy families.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Sweet Jesus.

turns.speaker: ANDANTE
turns.text: A sweetheart or a pretty little wife is Papageno's wish. A willing, billing, lovey dovey Would be My most tasty little dish. Be my most tasty little dish! Be my most tasty little dish!

turns.speaker: ALLEGRO
turns.text: Then that would be eating and drinking I'd live like a Prince without thinking. The wisdom of old would be mine - A woman's much better than wine! Then that would be eating and drinking! The wisdom of old would be mine - A woman's much better than wine. She's much better than wine! She's much better than wine!

turns.speaker: ANDANTE
turns.text: A sweetheart or a pretty little wife is Papageno's wish. A willing, billing, lovey dovey Would be My most tasty little dish.

turns.speaker: ALLEGRO
turns.text: I need to net one birdie only And I will stop feeling so lonely. But if she won't fly to my aid, Then into a ghost I must fade. I need to net one birdie only But if she won't fly to my aid, Then into a ghost I must fade.  To a ghost I must fade! To a ghost I must fade!

turns.speaker: ANDANTE
turns.text: A sweetheart or a pretty little wife is Papageno's wish. A willing, billing, lovey dovey Would be My most tasty little dish.

turns.speaker: ALLEGRO
turns.text: At present the girls only peck me. Their cruelty surely will wreck me. But one little beak in my own, And I'll up to heaven be flown! At present the girls only peck me. But one little beak in my own, And I'll up to heaven be flown. Up to heaven be flown! Up to heaven be flown!

turns.speaker: ARCO
turns.text: Follow me, please. The Archbishop would like a word.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Certainly!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Well, I think that went off remarkably well, don't you?

turns.speaker: ARCO
turns.text: Indeed.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: These Viennese certainly know good music when they hear it.

turns.speaker: ARCO
turns.text: His Grace is very angry with you.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Maestro.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Good morning.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Well? How do you like it? It's Turkish. My hairdresser tells me everything's going to be Turkish this year!

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Really? What else did he tell you today? Give me some gossip.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Well, I heard you met Herr Mozart.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Oh? News travels fast in Vienna.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: And he's been commissioned to write an opera. Is it true?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Is there a part for me?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Well even if there is, I don't think you want to get involved with this one.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Well, do you know where it's set, my dear?

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: In a harem.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: A brothel.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: A Turkish brothel.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Turkish? Oh, if it's Turkish, that's different. I want to be in it.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: My dear, it will hardly enhance your reputation to be celebrated throughout Vienna as a singing prostitute for a Turk.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Oh. Well perhaps you could introduce us anyway.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Perhaps.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: What does he look like?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: You might be disappointed.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Looks and talent don't always go together, Katherina.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Looks don't concern me, Maestro. Only talent interests a woman of taste.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Did you know? Had you heard?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: The marriage!

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Well, what does it matter to you?

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Nothing! He can marry who he pleases. I don't give a damn.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: How was I? Tell me honestly.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: You were sublime.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: What did you think of the music?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Extremely clever.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Meaning you didn't like it.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Katherina! I'll tell you what I'm going to do. I'm going to write another aria for you. Something even more amazing for the second act. I have to get some water. Her mother is lying on the stage.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Don't bother!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Don't bother.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: I'll be right back.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Oh - excuse me!

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Is her mother still lying on the floor?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: No, she's fine.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: I'm so relieved.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: Is she a good fuck?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: What??

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: I assume she's the virtuoso in that department. There can't be any other reason you'd marry someone like that.

turns.speaker: CAVALIERI
turns.text: No, no, no, no. You can't take him away now. This is his night. Won't you introduce us, Wolfgang?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Excuse us, Fraulein. Good night, Signore.

turns.speaker: COLLOREDO
turns.text: No! I won't have him back.

turns.speaker: LEOPOLD
turns.text: But he needs to be here in Salzburg, Your Grace. He needs me and he needs you. Your protection, your understanding.

turns.speaker: COLLOREDO
turns.text: Hardly.

turns.speaker: LEOPOLD
turns.text: Oh sir, yes! He's about to make the worst mistake of his life. Some little Viennese slut is trying to trick him into marriage. I know my son. He is too simple to see the trap - and there is no one there who really cares for him.

turns.speaker: COLLOREDO
turns.text: I'm not surprised. Money seems to be more important to him than loyalty or friendship. He has sold himself to Vienna. Let Vienna look out for him.

turns.speaker: LEOPOLD
turns.text: Sir -

turns.speaker: COLLOREDO
turns.text: Your son is an unprincipled, spoiled, conceited brat.

turns.speaker: LEOPOLD
turns.text: Yes, sir, that's the truth. But don't blame him. The fault is mine. I was too indulgent with him. But not again. Never again, I promise! I implore you - let me bring him back here. I'll make him give his word to serve you faithfully.

turns.speaker: COLLOREDO
turns.text: And how will you make him keep it?

turns.speaker: LEOPOLD
turns.text: Oh, sir, he's never disobeyed me in anything. Please, Your Grace, give him one more chance.

turns.speaker: COLLOREDO
turns.text: You have leave to try.

turns.speaker: LEOPOLD
turns.text: Oh, Your Grace - I thank Your Grace! I thank you!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Why what, sir?

turns.speaker: COLLOREDO
turns.text: Why do I have to be humiliated in front of my guests by one of my own servants?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Humiliated?

turns.speaker: COLLOREDO
turns.text: How much provocation am I to endure from you? The more license I allow you, the more you take.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: If His Grace is not satisfied with me, he can dismiss me.

turns.speaker: COLLOREDO
turns.text: I wish you to return immediately to Salzburg. Your father is waiting for you there patiently. I will speak to you further when I come.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: No, Your Grace! I mean with all humility, no. I would rather you dismissed me. It's obvious I don't satisfy.

turns.speaker: COLLOREDO
turns.text: Then try harder, Mozart. I have no intention of dismissing you. You will remain in my service and learn your place. Go now.

turns.speaker: COMMENDATORE
turns.text: Don Giovannnnnnnni!

turns.speaker: SCHIKANEDER
turns.text: Who the devil are you? What do you want?

turns.speaker: COMMENDATORE
turns.text: I've come to dinnnnnner!

turns.speaker: SCHIKANEDER
turns.text: Dinner? How dare you? I am a nobleman. I only dine with people of my own height.

turns.speaker: COMMENDATORE
turns.text: Are you drunk? You invited me. And my horse. Here he is. Ottavio!

turns.speaker: SCHIKANEDER
turns.text: In the pot, I have got a good dinner. Not a sausage or stew, but a singer. Not a sausage or stew but a singer. Is the treat that I'll eat for my meat!

turns.speaker: COMMENDATORE
turns.text: Oh shut up. I'm sick to death of that tune.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I want to go!

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I want to go back to Vienna.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Now?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I feel wrong. I feel wrong being here.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Stop it!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: I am! I am! I'm stopping it - slowly. You see! Look, I've stopped. Now we are going back.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: No! No! No!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Yes! Back! Back! Listen - don't you know where you are?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: We are in the Residence of the Fartsbishop of Salzburg.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Fartsbishop!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Your Grace, I've got something to tell you. I want to complain about this man.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Go ahead, tell him. Tell them all. They won't understand you anyway.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Because here everything goes backwards. People walk backwards, dance backwards, sing backwards, and talk backwards.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: That's stupid.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Why? People fart backwards.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Do you think that's funny?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Yes, I think it's brilliant. You've been doing it for years.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Oh, ha, ha, ha.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Sra-I'm-sick! Sra-I'm sick!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Yes, you are. You're very sick.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: No, no. Say it backwards, shit-wit. Sra-I'm-sick Say it backwards!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Sra-I'm-sick. Sick - kiss I'm - my Kiss my! Sra-I'm-sick - Kiss my arse!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Em iram! Em iram!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: No, I'm not playing this game.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: No, this is serious. Say it backwards.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Just say it - you'll see. It's very serious. Em iram!  Em iram!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Iram - marry Em - marry me! No, no! You're a fiend. I'm not going to marry a fiend. A dirty fiend at that.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Ui-vol-i-tub!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Tub - but i-tub - but I vol - love but I love ui - You. I love you!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Tish-I'm tee. What's that?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Tish-I'm-tee.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Eat

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Eat my - ah!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Excuse me, Wolfi. Mama is not feeling very well. Can we leave now?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I think you're mad! You're really mad!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Oh, leave me alone.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: One royal pupil and the whole of Vienna will come flocking. We'd be set up for life!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: They'll come anyway. They love me here.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: No, they will not. I know how things work in this city.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Oh yes? You always know everything.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Well, I'm not borrowing any more money from my mother, and that's that!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: You borrowed money from your mother?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Well, don't do that again!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: How are we going to live, Wolfi? Do you want me to go into the streets and beg?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Don't be stupid.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: All they want to see is your work. What's wrong with that?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Shut up! Just shut up! I don't need them.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: This isn't pride. It's sheer stupidity!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Stop it now. Stop it. I've brought some friends to meet you. They're next door waiting. Do we have anything to eat? They're all starving.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Tell them to go away. I don't want to see anybody.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Tell them to go!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Sssh. What is it? Tell me.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I love you! I love you!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: My Stanzi - look at her! Isn't she beautiful? Come on now, confess, Papa. Could you want a prettier girl for a daughter?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Stop it, Wolfi. I look dreadful. Welcome to our house, Herr Mozart.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: He's not Herr Mozart. Call him Papa.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: May I offer you some tea, Herr Mozart?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Tea? Who wants tea? Let's go out! This calls for a feast. You don't want tea, Papa. Let's go dancing. Papa loves parties, don't you?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Wolfi!

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: What? How can you be so boring? Tea!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Wolfi, I think your father's tired. I'll cook us something here.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: There's a young girl to see you.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: What does she want?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Well, ask her!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: She won't talk to me. She says she has to speak to you.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Oh, damn!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Look, old man, you stay out of this. We spend a fortune on you, more than we can possibly afford, and all you do is criticize, morning to night. And then you think you can -

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Stanzi!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: No, it's right he should hear. I'm sick to death of it. We can't do anything right for you, can we?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: We'll have a little party. Come in. Come in. You know Herr Schikaneder?  This is! a very nice girl.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Wolfi.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Yes, my love?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: These gentlemen are from Salzburg.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Salzburg.  We were just talking about Salzburg.  If you've come from my friend the Fartsbishop, you've arrived at just the right moment. Because I've got good news for him. I'm done with Vienna. It's over, finished, done with! Done with! Done with!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Wolfi! Your father is dead.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Your father is dead.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Half the receipts! Stanzi!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I'm talking about now. How much will you give him now? Down payment?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: You're not going to do this?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Why not? Half the house!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: When? We need money now. Either he pays now, or you don't do it.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Oh, Stanzi.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I don't trust this man. And I didn't like what he did with your opera. It was common.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Well, you liked it, didn't you? Monkey-flunki-punki.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Half the house! You'll never see a penny. I want it here, in my hand.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Stanzi-manzi, I'll put it in your hand!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Shut up! I'll not let you put anything in my hand until I see some money.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Who was that?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: No one.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I heard voices.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: What's that? Oh!  Who gave you this? How much is it? Wolfi, who gave you this?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: I'm not telling you.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: You'd think I was mad.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: No. Don't answer it!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: This is my wife, Stanzi. I've been sick, but I'm all right now. Aren't I?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Oh yes, sir. He's all right. And he's working on it very hard.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Give me two more weeks. Please.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Give me one reason I can understand.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: I can't write it!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: It's killing me.

turns.speaker: MOZART
turns.text: Go back to bed.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Please! Let me sit here. Let me stay here with you. I promise I won't say all word. I'll just be here, so you know no one's going to hurt you. Please, please!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Excellency!

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Madame. How can I help you?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Frau Mozart?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: That's right, Your Excellency. I've come on behalf of my hus band. I'm - I'm bringing some samples of his work so he can be considered for the royal appointment.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: How charming.  But why did he not come himself?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: He's terribly busy, sir.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: I will look at them, of course, the moment I can. It will be an honour. Please give him my warmest.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Would it be too much trouble, sir, to ask you to look at them now? While I wait.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: I'm afraid I'm not at leisure this very moment. Just leave them with me. I assure you they will be quite safe.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I - I really cannot do that, Your Excellency. You see, he doesn't know I'm here.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: My husband is a proud man, sir. He would be furious if he knew I'd come.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Then he didn't send you?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: No, sir. This is my own idea.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Sir, we really need this job. We're desperate. My husband spends far more than he can ever earn. I don't mean he's lazy - he's not at all - he works all day long. It's just! he's not practical. Money simply slips through his fingers, it's really ridiculous, Your Excellency. I know you help musicians. You're famous for it. Give him just this one post. We'd be forever indebted!

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Thank you very much, Your Excellency.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Don't keep calling me that. It puts me at such a distance. I was not born a Court Composer, you know. I'm from a small town, just like your husband.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Are you sure you can't leave that music, and come back again? I have other things you might like.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: That's very tempting, but it's impossible, I'm afraid. Wolfi would be frantic if he found those were missing. You see, they're all originals.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Originals?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: These are originals?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Yes, sir. He doesn't make copies.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: It is miraculous.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Oh yes. He's really proud of his work.

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Tomorrow night I dine with the Emperor. One word from me and the post is his.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Oh, thank you, sir!

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Come back tonight.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Tonight?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Alone.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Some service deserves service in return. No?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Isn't it obvious?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: It's a post all Vienna seeks. If you want it for your husband, come tonight.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: But! I'm a married woman!

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: Then don't. It's up to you. Not to be vague, that is the price.

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: I do apologize for this afternoon. I behaved like a silly girl. Where shall we go?

turns.speaker: SALIERI
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CONSTANZE
turns.text: Should we stay here? It's a charming room. I love these candlesticks. Were they here earlier? I didn't notice them I suppose I was too nervous.
